channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Waypoint Generation in Row-based Crops with Deep Learning and Contrastive Clustering
item.description: In this paper, we propose a learning-based approach to tackle waypoint generation for planning a navigation path for row-based crops, starting from a top-view map of the region-of-interest.

item.title: Mining Error Templates for Grammatical Error Correction
item.description: We have accumulated 1, 119 error templates for Chinese GEC based on this method.

item.title: A Geometric Method for Improved Uncertainty Estimation in Real-time
item.description: Predicting the probability of a specific input to be correct is called uncertainty (or confidence) estimation and is crucial for risk management.

item.title: Utilizing Expert Features for Contrastive Learning of Time-Series Representations
item.description: We therefore devise ExpCLR, a novel contrastive learning approach built on an objective that utilizes expert features to encourage both properties for the learned representation.

item.title: plingo: A system for probabilistic reasoning in clingo based on lpmln
item.description: We present plingo, an extension of the ASP system clingo with various probabilistic reasoning modes.

item.title: Remote Sensing Change Detection (Segmentation) using Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Models
item.description: Human civilization has an increasingly powerful influence on the earth system, and earth observations are an invaluable tool for assessing and mitigating the negative impacts.

item.title: Two-dimensional total absorption spectroscopy with conditional generative adversarial networks
item.description: We explore the use of machine learning techniques to remove the response of large volume $\gamma$-ray detectors from experimental spectra.

item.title: RetroGraph: Retrosynthetic Planning with Graph Search
item.description: We observe that the same intermediate molecules are visited many times in the searching process, and they are usually independently treated in previous tree-based methods (e. g., AND-OR tree search, Monte Carlo tree search).

item.title: Toward Clinically Assisted Colorectal Polyp Recognition via Structured Cross-modal Representation Consistency
item.description: By aligning the class tokens and spatial attention maps of paired NBI and WL images at different levels, the Transformer achieves the ability to keep both global and local representation consistency for the above two modalities.

item.title: VRKitchen2.0-IndoorKit: A Tutorial for Augmented Indoor Scene Building in Omniverse
item.description: With the recent progress of simulations by 3D modeling software and game engines, many researchers have focused on Embodied AI tasks in the virtual environment.

item.title: A Topological characterisation of Weisfeiler-Leman equivalence classes
item.description: In this article, we rely on the theory of covering spaces to fully characterize the classes of graphs that GNNs cannot distinguish.

item.title: Explore Spatio-temporal Aggregation for Insubstantial Object Detection: Benchmark Dataset and Baseline
item.description: We endeavor on a rarely explored task named Insubstantial Object Detection (IOD), which aims to localize the object with following characteristics: (1) amorphous shape with indistinct boundary; (2) similarity to surroundings; (3) absence in color.

item.title: Theory-Grounded Measurement of U.S. Social Stereotypes in English Language Models
item.description: NLP models trained on text have been shown to reproduce human stereotypes, which can magnify harms to marginalized groups when systems are deployed at scale.

item.title: Complementary datasets to COCO for object detection
item.description: For nearly a decade, the COCO dataset has been the central test bed of research in object detection.

item.title: Global Sensing and Measurements Reuse for Image Compressed Sensing
item.description: However, existing methods obtain measurements only from partial features in the network and use them only once for image reconstruction.

item.title: Open-source FPGA-ML codesign for the MLPerf Tiny Benchmark
item.description: We present our development experience and recent results for the MLPerf Tiny Inference Benchmark on field-programmable gate array (FPGA) platforms.

item.title: Gradual Domain Adaptation via Normalizing Flows
item.description: We propose using normalizing flows to mitigate this problem while maintaining the framework of unsupervised domain adaptation.

item.title: Human-in-the-Loop Large-Scale Predictive Maintenance of Workstations
item.description: We propose a human-in-the-loop PdM approach in which a machine learning system predicts future problems in sets of workstations (computers, laptops, and servers).

item.title: Evidence fusion with contextual discounting for multi-modality medical image segmentation
item.description: As information sources are usually imperfect, it is necessary to take into account their reliability in multi-source information fusion tasks.

item.title: Warped Convolution Networks for Homography Estimation
item.description: In this paper, we propose Warped Convolution Networks (WCN) to effectively estimate the homography transformation by SL(3) group and sl(3) algebra with group convolution.

item.title: ICOS Protein Expression Segmentation: Can Transformer Networks Give Better Results?
item.description: Biomarkers identify a patients response to treatment.

item.title: ReuseKNN: Neighborhood Reuse for Privacy-Aware Recommendations
item.description: User-based KNN recommender systems (UserKNN) utilize the rating data of a target user's k nearest neighbors in the recommendation process.

item.title: Shilling Black-box Recommender Systems by Learning to Generate Fake User Profiles
item.description: Leg-UP learns user behavior patterns from real users in the sampled ``templates'' and constructs fake user profiles.

item.title: On the Generalizability and Predictability of Recommender Systems
item.description: By using far more meta-training data than prior work, RecZilla is able to substantially reduce the level of human involvement when faced with a new recommender system application.

item.title: NovelCraft: A Dataset for Novelty Detection and Discovery in Open Worlds
item.description: Results suggest an opportunity for future research: models aware of task-specific costs of different types of mistakes could more effectively detect and adapt to novelty in open worlds.

item.title: Physics-Informed Statistical Modeling for Wildfire Aerosols Process Using Multi-Source Geostationary Satellite Remote-Sensing Data Streams
item.description: Increasingly frequent wildfires significantly affect solar energy production as the atmospheric aerosols generated by wildfires diminish the incoming solar radiation to the earth.

item.title: Frequency Dependent Sound Event Detection for DCASE 2022 Challenge Task 4
item.description: While many deep learning methods on other domains have been applied to sound event detection (SED), differences between original domains of the methods and SED have not been appropriately considered so far.

item.title: Rethinking Surgical Instrument Segmentation: A Background Image Can Be All You Need
item.description: Data diversity and volume are crucial to the success of training deep learning models, while in the medical imaging field, the difficulty and cost of data collection and annotation are especially huge.

item.title: Prototypical Contrastive Language Image Pretraining
item.description: In this paper, we show a representation grouping effect during this process: the InfoNCE objective indirectly groups semantically similar representations together via randomly emerged within-modal anchors.

item.title: Near-optimal control of dynamical systems with neural ordinary differential equations
item.description: Optimal control problems naturally arise in many scientific applications where one wishes to steer a dynamical system from a certain initial state $\mathbf{x}_0$ to a desired target state $\mathbf{x}^*$ in finite time $T$.

item.title: $\texttt{FedBC}$: Calibrating Global and Local Models via Federated Learning Beyond Consensus
item.description: In federated learning (FL), the objective of collaboratively learning a global model through aggregation of model updates across devices tends to oppose the goal of personalization via local information.

item.title: S2TNet: Spatio-Temporal Transformer Networks for Trajectory Prediction in Autonomous Driving
item.description: To safely and rationally participate in dense and heterogeneous traffic, autonomous vehicles require to sufficiently analyze the motion patterns of surrounding traffic-agents and accurately predict their future trajectories.

item.title: Open Vocabulary Object Detection with Proposal Mining and Prediction Equalization
item.description: Open-vocabulary object detection (OVD) aims to scale up vocabulary size to detect objects of novel categories beyond the training vocabulary.

item.title: Bregman Power k-Means for Clustering Exponential Family Data
item.description: Recent progress in center-based clustering algorithms combats poor local minima by implicit annealing, using a family of generalized means.

item.title: Diagnostic Tool for Out-of-Sample Model Evaluation
item.description: Assessment of model fitness is an important step in many problems.

item.title: Imitation Learning for Generalizable Self-driving Policy with Sim-to-real Transfer
item.description: Imitation Learning uses the demonstrations of an expert to uncover the optimal policy and it is suitable for real-world robotics tasks as well.

item.title: Connecting a French Dictionary from the Beginning of the 20th Century to Wikidata
item.description: In this paper, we describe a new lexical resource, where we connected all the dictionary entries of the history and geography part to current data sources.

item.title: Hierarchical Context Tagging for Utterance Rewriting
item.description: HCT (i) tags the source string with token-level edit actions and slotted rules and (ii) fills in the resulting rule slots with spans from the dialogue context.

item.title: Event-triggered and distributed model predictive control for guaranteed collision avoidance in UAV swarms
item.description: Distributed model predictive control (DMPC) is often used to tackle path planning for unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) swarms.

item.title: A view of mini-batch SGD via generating functions: conditions of convergence, phase transitions, benefit from negative momenta
item.description: Mini-batch SGD with momentum is a fundamental algorithm for learning large predictive models.

item.title: DaisyRec 2.0: Benchmarking Recommendation for Rigorous Evaluation
item.description: Recently, one critical issue looms large in the field of recommender systems -- there are no effective benchmarks for rigorous evaluation -- which consequently leads to unreproducible evaluation and unfair comparison.

item.title: Multi-LexSum: Real-World Summaries of Civil Rights Lawsuits at Multiple Granularities
item.description: With the advent of large language models, methods for abstractive summarization have made great strides, creating potential for use in applications to aid knowledge workers processing unwieldy document collections.

item.title: Langevin Monte Carlo for Contextual Bandits
item.description: Existing Thompson sampling-based algorithms need to construct a Laplace approximation (i. e., a Gaussian distribution) of the posterior distribution, which is inefficient to sample in high dimensional applications for general covariance matrices.

item.title: SpA-Former: Transformer image shadow detection and removal via spatial attention
item.description: In this paper, we propose an end-to-end SpA-Former to recover a shadow-free image from a single shaded image.

item.title: SVoRT: Iterative Transformer for Slice-to-Volume Registration in Fetal Brain MRI
item.description: Experiments with real-world MRI data are also performed to demonstrate the ability of the proposed model to improve the quality of 3D reconstruction under severe fetal motion.

item.title: tntorch: Tensor Network Learning with PyTorch
item.description: We present tntorch, a tensor learning framework that supports multiple decompositions (including Candecomp/Parafac, Tucker, and Tensor Train) under a unified interface.

item.title: Assessing mutualistic metacommunity capacity by integrating spatial and interaction networks
item.description: We develop a spatially realistic model of mutualistic metacommunities that exploits the joint structure of spatial and interaction networks.

item.title: Feature Re-calibration based MIL for Whole Slide Image Classification
item.description: Whole slide image (WSI) classification is a fundamental task for the diagnosis and treatment of diseases; but, curation of accurate labels is time-consuming and limits the application of fully-supervised methods.

item.title: The ArtBench Dataset: Benchmarking Generative Models with Artworks
item.description: We introduce ArtBench-10, the first class-balanced, high-quality, cleanly annotated, and standardized dataset for benchmarking artwork generation.

item.title: Optimistic Linear Support and Successor Features as a Basis for Optimal Policy Transfer
item.description: If reward functions are expressed linearly, and the agent has previously learned a set of policies for different tasks, successor features (SFs) can be exploited to combine such policies and identify reasonable solutions for new problems.
